page.title: 13TILE HILL RAILWAY STATION
page.content: The railway line which runs through Tile Hill was opened on September 17th 1838. Twelve freight trains use this line every day. The London Express travels along this line but does not stop at this station. Sixty six local trains stop here every day between 06.26 and 23.49 hours and about 170 passengers use this station (only one first class passenger in ten years) mainly travelling to Birmingham. The signalling for the crossing is worked from Coventry and there are two cameras surveying the track to check it is clear. Tile Hill Station has two staff who work in shifts, either 6.10 until 14.30, or 14.20 until midnight every day. The tickets they issue have a different colour strip down the side for different days.
